physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On presentation, large exophthalmos of the left eye, periorbital swelling, chemosis, and continuous discharge. Bruit noted over the forehead and left temporal bone.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, significant improvement in exophthalmos and disappearance of periorbital pain. At 6 weeks postsurgery, exophthalmos had almost completely disappeared, but no improvement in vision.
